title: Sources: QB Daniels dislocated elbow in loss
content: Jayden Daniels is expected to be sidelined indefinitely, but it is uncertain whether his season is over, sources said.

title: Darnold stars with 4 TDs in win, boosts MVP odds
content: En route to a 38-14 win over the Commanders on Sunday night, Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold finished 21-of-24 with 330 yards, four touchdowns and one interception, boosting his odds for NFL MVP as his team improved to 6-2.

title: Little drills record 68-yard FG, sparking Jags in win
content: Jacksonville Jaguars kicker Cam Little hit an NFL-record 68-yard field goal as time expired in the first half against the Las Vegas Raiders at Allegiant Stadium.

title: Bears thrilled, Bengals 'sick' after wild shootout
content: After the Bengals scored two touchdowns in a 49-second span to erase Chicago's 14-point lead, the Bears pulled off their fifth win of the season when Caleb Williams delivered a 58-yard touchdown to rookie Colston Loveland with 17 seconds remaining.

title: Cubs earn major-league-high 3 Gold Glove awards
content: The Cubs had a major-league-high three Gold Glove winners this year, with Pete Crow-Armstrong, Ian Happ and Nico Hoerner taking home the honor.

title: Knicks' Hart dealing with nerve injury in hand
content: Josh Hart admitted to dealing with a nerve issue in his shooting hand but said he's pressing forward after a season-best performance in the Knicks' win Sunday.

title: Morris claps back, says Patriots simulated snap
content: Falcons coach Raheem Morris said the Patriots defense simulated his team's snap on a key fourth-quarter play by clapping, leading to an intentional grounding penalty.

title: Henley plays on for Chargers after brother killed
content: Daiyan Henley played for the Chargers two days after his brother was shot and killed in Los Angeles. He had a sack, a pass deflection and seven tackles in the win over the Titans, later saying: "As traumatizing as all this is, I got a job to do."

title: D Schaefer, 18, authors historic multigoal game
content: New York's Matthew Schaefer, 18, added yet another milestone to his fast start with the Islanders on Sunday night, scoring two goals in a 3-2 victory over the Columbus Blue Jackets, to become the youngest defenseman in NHL history with a multigoal game.

title: As it happened: Haaland brace leads Man City, Barça top Elche
content: Another day, and more games across Europe this weekend! Sunday's action in the  Premier League  kicked off with  West Ham United  coming from a goal down to claim a much-needed  3-1  win over  Newcastle United . Then, we had  Manchester City  winning 3-1 against  Bournemouth  thanks to two goals from  Erling Haaland , and with the Cherries getting a goal from the  USMNT 's own  Tyler Adams . And in  LaLiga , we had  Barcelona  looking to bounce back from their  Clásico  loss as they beat  Elche  3-1. ( stream LIVE at 12:30 p.m. ET on ESPN+ in the U.S. ). Enjoy all of today's action from across the continent.

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: World Series champs -- again! Game 7 win cements Dodgers' dynasty
content: will Smith hits the go-ahead home run in extras as the Dodgers win their second straight world Series . the franchise closed out the Toronto Blue Jays with a 5-4 win in extra innings in Game 7 on Saturday . it was easy to think about the fourth lefty on the franchise's bullpen depth chart, a 37-year-old .

title: Every MLB team's odds to win the 2026 World Series: Dodgers open as favorites
content: The confetti has fallen on the 2025 MLB season, as the  Los Angeles Dodgers  completed a Game 7 comeback for the ages and claimed their second straight World Series championship, this time over the American League champion  Toronto Blue Jays . The star-studded Dodgers -- featuring  Shohei Ohtani  and  Mookie Betts  -- will return as the favorites to win the 2026 World Series, followed by the  New York Yankees ,  Houston Astros  and  Philadelphia Phillies . The Blue Jays open at 20-1, tied with the  Chicago Cubs  for 11th. The  Seattle Mariners , the AL runners-up, open at 14-1, while the  Milwaukee Brewers , who had the league's best record in 2025, open at 18-1. At the other end of the spectrum, the  Chicago White Sox  and  Colorado Rockies  open at 500-1. Odds as of publish time. For more, visit  ESPN BET Sportsbook.   By ESPN BET

title: AP Week 10 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: a wild week in the ACC with the two highest-ranked teams in the conference losing to unranked opponents . the AP top 25 is based on stats courtesy of ESPN Research . Ohio State has won nine straight games against Penn Staples .

title: Fantasy Football Buzz: Dowdle takes control of Panthers backfield, Loveland saves Bears
content: fantasy football is viewed from a fantasy football perspective . the news cycle will constantly affect player values in fantasy football . our fantasy football Buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the league .

title: Where Auburn ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: the 2025-26 coaching cycle wasn't expected to be calm, like its predecessor . but few forecast such a robust line of storms rolling through the sport in the first half of the season . all four power conferences have had a firing .

title: CFP top 12: One last projection before the first committee ranking
content: defending national champion Ohio State should start the first college football playoff rankings on Tuesday . there could be some debate over the top spot when the 12 members of this year's group vote on teams for their first official top 25 ranking of the season . the bigger discussion will likely revolve around one-loss Alabama and undefeated Texas A&M for the no. 3 and no. 4 spots .

title: Let's overreact to Week 9: Saints should deal Olave, Vikings don't need Cousins
content: the NFL trade deadline is only a couple of days away . the deadline is probably too early, because things change so much week to week in this league . we decided to make the week 9 Overreactions column all about the trade deadline . how were teams' deadline plans affected by what happened Sunday?

title: 🏆 CFP tiers, title odds and a simulated champ
content: two top-10 teams fell on the road to unranked opponents . a third fell to a lower-ranked team . two-thirds of the 2025 college football season done, we now shift into Playoff Hyperdrive .

title: 'Pakistan conducting nuclear tests': Trump makes big claim
content: US President Donald Trump claimed Pakistan, Russia, China, and North Korea are conducting nuclear tests, justifying the US's decision to resume its own after over 30 years. He stated testing is necessary to ensure the reliability of American weapons systems, citing recent trials by Russia. Energy Secretary Chris Wright later clarified that discussions involved non-critical system tests, not full nuclear explosions.

title: 'I'm broken': Lone AI-171 crash survivor speaks out; now stranded in UK
content: Four-and-a-half months after a devastating Air India crash, sole survivor Vishwashkumar Ramesh faces ongoing physical injuries, financial hardship, and deep trauma. He has not yet received NHS psychiatric care and his family's business has collapsed. Ramesh finds Air India's interim compensation inadequate for his needs.

title: Punjabi songs, bhangra, dark glasses & hoodie: Harmanpreet a vibe after historic win
content: Harmanpreet Kaur led India to their maiden World Cup victory, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. The captain's gut feeling to give Shafali Verma an over proved a turning point, securing crucial wickets. Celebrations were jubilant, with the team dedicating the win to Jhulan Goswami.

title: The return of the G-2 duopoly: US, China embrace leaves India out in the cold
content: US President Donald Trump has declared China a functional equal, signaling a new G-2 duopoly that sidelines other global powers. This marks a significant policy shift, moving away from viewing China as an existential threat. The move suggests a strategic realignment prioritizing US-China cooperation for global stability and success.

title: Honest admission: OpenAI CEO says company 'might screw it up'; admits risks remain
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman stated the company's revenue exceeds $13 billion annually, despite acknowledging potential pitfalls in its rapid growth. He addressed significant AI infrastructure commitments, asserting that long-term investments will yield substantial value. Altman expressed confidence in OpenAI's trajectory, supported by Microsoft's backing.

title: India win WC: A whopping Rs 90 cr! India women’s cricketers set to become crorepatis
content: India's historic ICC Women's World Cup 2025 victory has ushered in a new era for women's cricket, with the team set to receive over Rs 90 crore in prize money and cash rewards. This unprecedented financial windfall, including a record USD 4.48 million from the ICC, marks a significant transformation for the sport in India.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K and 24K gold costs in your city? Check list
content: Gold futures saw an uptick, driven by safe-haven demand amid geopolitical tensions and potential US export restrictions on AI hardware to China. This rise follows a weak performance last week, with investor interest and strong ETF inflows bolstering the bullion market in the third quarter.

title: Nvidia CEO on ‘find what you love’ - why he doesn't agree with the career mantra?
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang challenges the notion of finding passion first, suggesting it's easier to fall in love with your work through commitment and effort.  His own journey, from washing dishes to leading Nvidia, highlights how dedication to tasks, even humble ones, fosters success and resilience. This perspective is resonating widely in Silicon Valley.

title: Powerful earthquake in Russia: 5.8 magnitude quake jolts Kamchatka region
content: A powerful 6.4 magnitude earthquake has shaken the east coast of Russia's Kamchatka region. The tremor occurred at a depth of 28 kilometers. No injuries have been reported so far. The Kamchatka Peninsula is part of the Pacific Ring of Fire, an area known for frequent seismic activity due to shifting tectonic plates. This is a developing story.

title: Stray dogs case: Chief secretaries of states tender apology; SC to pronounce order on November 7
content: Chief secretaries of various states have offered an unconditional apology to the Supreme Court for failing to file responses on stray dog bite prevention measures. The court, taking suo motu cognizance, also permitted dog bite victims to participate in the hearing. Justices expressed intent to issue orders concerning government institutions supporting dogs on their premises.

title: Choke’s on you: Delhi AQI inches towards ‘severe’ at five stations
content: Delhi's air quality plunged to a season-high 'very poor' AQI of 388 on Sunday, with forecasts predicting a move to 'severe' by Tuesday. Afternoon winds offered temporary relief, but stagnant conditions are trapping pollutants.  Several monitoring stations already registered severe levels, highlighting the onset of the city's most polluted period.

title: India's World Cup win: Twitter 'explodes' 456%; shares Virat Kohli tweet
content: India's women's cricket team has achieved a historic maiden World Cup victory, sparking a massive 456.5% surge in conversations on X (formerly Twitter) within 24 hours. The nation erupted in celebration after the team's dominant performance against South Africa. This monumental win, lauded by figures like Virat Kohli, Sundar Pichai, and Satya Nadella, marks a new era for women's cricket in India and inspires future generations.

title: Two desi lads in Silicon Valley become youngest self-made billionaires at 22
content: Three 22-year-old friends, including Indian-Americans Adarsh Hiremath and Surya Midha, have become the world's youngest self-made billionaires. Their AI recruiting platform, Mercor, secured $350 million in funding, valuing the company at $10 billion.  This Silicon Valley startup, born from high school debate skills, now serves major AI labs and tech giants.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold rate outlook for this week?
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are expected to face downward pressure in the near future due to global developments. A stronger dollar and easing US-China trade tensions have reduced safe-haven demand.

title: ‘A mistake’: George Clooney criticises Kamala Harris’s 2024 presidential run
content: George Clooney stated the Democratic Party erred by nominating Vice President Kamala Harris, citing her difficult position running against her own record. He reiterated his belief that President Biden should have stepped aside for a new nominee, advocating for a primary contest instead of a virtual confirmation. Clooney's earlier op-ed expressed concerns about Biden's re-election prospects.

title: Wonder Women! A look at India’s 2025 World Cup heroes
content: India's women cricketers achieved a remarkable feat at the 2025 ODI World Cup. They showcased resilience and collective resolve throughout the tournament. Key players delivered outstanding performances, including record-breaking chases and dramatic comebacks. This campaign promises to redefine the future of Indian women's cricket. The team's journey captivated the nation.

title: Applying for US universities? You might need to submit biometric details too
content: The US Department of Homeland Security has proposed a rule requiring all immigration applicants, including students applying for study visas, to submit biometric data such as fingerprints, facial scans, and DNA. The rule expands DHS’s authority to collect and store biometrics, apply them across multiple applications, and excusing failures to attend appointments in extraordinary circumstances. Public comments are open until January 2, 2026, allowing students and stakeholders to provide feedback before the rule is finalised.

title: US tariffs hit India’s export engine: GTRI report shows 37.5% slump across key sectors
content: India's exports to the US plummeted 37.5% between May and September 2025 due to sweeping tariff hikes by the Trump administration. Shipments fell from $8.8 billion to $5.5 billion, with smartphones and pharmaceuticals being the biggest casualties. The report highlights a sharp deterioration in India's competitiveness, risking market share loss to other nations.

title: Victory parade after Women's World Cup win? Here's what we know so far
content: The BCCI has not yet planned a victory parade for the women's cricket team's World Cup win. Secretary Devajit Saikia stated that plans will be made upon the return of senior officials from ICC meetings in Dubai. The board will also address the missing Asia Cup trophy.

title: Mehli Mistry files caveat on removal from Tata Trusts
content: Mehli Mistry, executor of Ratan Tata's will, has filed a caveat with the charity commissioner after his reappointment to Tata Trusts boards was denied by a majority. He seeks an opportunity to be heard before any changes are sanctioned, as the Trusts must report board composition changes within 90 days.

title: Trump threatens US military action in Nigeria, vows to halt aid over Christian killings
content: Former US President Donald Trump has threatened military intervention and aid cuts to Nigeria, citing the alleged killing of Christians. He instructed the Department of War to prepare for action, warning the Nigerian government to act swiftly.

title: India's North Star! Harmanpreet Kaur's 2017 WC knock showed India's talent was global
content: Harmanpreet Kaur's fearless 89 in the 2025 World Cup semifinal powered India's stunning comeback. Her journey from Moga, Punjab, marked by an epochal 171 in 2017, transformed women's cricket, paving the way for visibility and opportunities. She remains a beacon for aspiring cricketers, embodying grit and global ambition.

title: 20 dead, several injured as tipper truck collides with RTC bus on Hyderabad-Bijapur highway
content: A devastating road accident in Telangana's Rangareddy district claimed at least 20 lives when a gravel-laden truck collided head-on with an RTC bus. The collision occurred near Mirzaguda, with the truck's load of gravel falling onto passengers. Authorities are investigating the cause, while the Chief Minister has ordered immediate relief and medical attention for the injured.

title: 'Have enough nukes to ... ': Nuclear testing, Mamdani & more — 10 things Trump told '60 Minutes'
content: President Trump, in a candid interview, asserted that Russia and China are secretly testing nuclear weapons. He also claimed credit for preventing a nuclear conflict between India and Pakistan, and defended his administration's tough stance on immigration and Iran's nuclear ambitions. Trump squarely blamed Democrats for the ongoing government shutdown.

title: At the stroke of midnight, India awake as World Champions!
content: Outclassing South Africa by 52 runs in the final of the 2025 Women’s ODI World Cup at the DY Patil Stadium on Sunday night, with 45,000 fans cheering them, India finally put an end to their long wait for an elusive World Cup crown. A billion hearts can now celebrate the Women in Blue’s memorable, historic, game-changing triumph for women’s cricket in India for a long time to come — courtesy of a player who wasn’t even in the reserves!

title: Trump warns of economic collapse: What if US Supreme Court strikes down tariffs?
content: President Trump warns of severe economic fallout if the Supreme Court overturns his tariff policy. He claims tariffs have fueled record stock market highs and 401(k) growth. The upcoming Supreme Court case challenges his authority to impose these taxes, which have generated billions in revenue, potentially requiring repayment if ruled unlawful.

title: Peak Bengaluru moment: Man spotted wearing frying pan instead of helmet - watch
content: A pillion rider in Bengaluru was filmed using a frying pan as a helmet to avoid a traffic challan. While the incident sparked amusement online, it also highlighted serious concerns about road safety and the importance of proper protective gear. The video serves as a stark reminder that such stunts are dangerous and not worth the risk of head injury.

title: PM Modi inaugrates ESTIC, launches Rs 1 lakh-cr fund to boost R&D investment
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated ESTIC 2025, launching a Rs 1 lakh-crore RDI Scheme Fund to boost private sector R&D and announcing the Anusandhan Research Foundation. The event, featuring over 3,000 participants, aims to foster innovation across 11 thematic areas, highlighting India's growing role as a technology pioneer.

title: Your zodiac sign is 2,000 years out of date
content: Your zodiac sign may be inaccurate. Ancient astronomers based signs on constellations. Earth's wobble has shifted these star patterns over 2,000 years. Today, Western astrology uses seasonal signs, not star positions. Indian astrology aligns with star movements. Astronomy and astrology separated long ago. Belief in astrology persists due to its adaptability.

title: This city has no cars, no pollution, clean water — and even solar-powered bins
content: Freiburg, Germany, showcases a sustainable urban future with its widespread solar energy, car-free mobility, and integrated green culture. This university city prioritizes cycling and public transport, featuring energy-efficient homes and community involvement. Freiburg offers a compelling model for cities worldwide, proving that ecological living enhances quality of life and fosters happier societies.

title: Shafali Verma reveals how Sachin Tendulkar inspired her World Cup heroics
content: Shafali Verma, at 21, became the youngest Player of the Match in a World Cup semi-final or final with her 87 runs and two wickets. Her performance powered India to their maiden ICC Women's World Cup title, defeating South Africa by 52 runs and marking a historic victory.

title: JEE Main 2026: NTA confirms calculators not allowed; clarifies typo error
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified that a virtual calculator will not be available for JEE Main 2026. An earlier mention in the Information Bulletin was a typographical error from a generic template. The NTA has uploaded a revised bulletin and expressed regret for any inconvenience caused to candidates.

title: 'Need more govt assistance': Hopes & hardships echo at PM Modi's Bihar rally; mixed opinions in Ara
content: Women at Prime Minister Modi's rally in Ara voiced mixed opinions, appreciating free ration but seeking more assistance and highlighting local corruption. While some praised Nitish-Modi's work, others, like a tea shop owner, stressed the urgent need for youth employment, with a trader noting improved security but also migration concerns.

title: The journey of belief: How India’s women kept the fire burning
content: A century-long dream culminated as India's women's cricket team reached the 2025 World Cup final, a testament to growing conviction and talent. This journey, from compulsory cricket in 1913 to a home-ground final, signifies a nation's awakening interest and the evolution of the sport from a struggle to a celebrated pursuit.

title: US government shutdown impact: Airports reel under travel chaos
content: Widespread flight delays and cancellations plagued US airports as the government shutdown, now the longest in history, entered its second month. Air traffic controllers and TSA officers are working without pay, leading to stress and fatigue, while airlines and unions urge Congress to pass a funding bill to end the crisis.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams “disgusting” Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
content: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: Spirit of Champions! Indian players console heartbroken South Africans - watch
content: India's maiden ICC Women's World Cup 2025 victory in Navi Mumbai was marked by exceptional sportsmanship. Following their win over South Africa, Indian players displayed remarkable empathy, consoling their tearful opponents. Moments of compassion between teammates and rivals, like Jemimah Rodrigues comforting Marizanne Kapp and Smriti Mandhana speaking with Laura Wolvaardt, truly defined the spirit of cricket.

title: Trump’s nuclear push stirs confusion: Tests to include explosions? What energy secretary said
content: US President Trump's order for nuclear weapons system tests sparked global concern about a return to nuclear explosions. Energy Secretary Chris Wright clarified these are non-nuclear system tests, not detonations, aimed at modernizing the arsenal. This follows Trump's statement about resuming testing on an equal basis with other nations, despite a decades-long moratorium.

title: 'We are the champions!': Harmanpreet's leap & India's glory – watch winning moment
content: India has been crowned Women's World Champions after a thrilling victory at the DY Patil Stadium. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur's spectacular catch sealed the win, sparking jubilant celebrations. Shafali Verma's 87 and Deepti Sharma's all-round performance were pivotal in securing the historic triumph, marking a new era for Indian women's cricket.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday on weak global cues. While Nifty50 was below 25,700, BSE Sensex was down over 200 points.

title: India win World Cup: 'Champions of the World!' - Mithali Raj pens an emotional tribute
content: India's women's cricket team achieved a historic first, clinching the ICC Women's World Cup by defeating South Africa. Legendary former captain Mithali Raj expressed profound emotion, seeing her decades-long dream realized. The team's remarkable comeback journey, culminating in a dominant final performance, fulfilled the aspirations of generations of players and fans alike.

title: Trump says US will back Netanyahu in his criminal trial, calls charges 'unfair'
content: Former US President Donald Trump declared Washington's intention to intervene in Benjamin Netanyahu's criminal trial, deeming it "very unfair." Trump, who has previously criticized the charges against the Israeli Prime Minister, also asserted he could swiftly compel Hamas to disarm or face elimination, while praising Netanyahu as the right leader for Israel during wartime.

title: Bengaluru ambulance turns killer: Beacon and siren led to death of couple dead, 2 injured
content: A speeding ambulance, reportedly without a patient, ran a red light at Kengal Hanumanthaiah Junction, colliding with two motorbikes. The tragic accident resulted in the deaths of a couple and grievous injuries to two others. The ambulance driver, who fled the scene, has since been arrested.

title: 'Hide your quarterback': Panthers target Jordan Love, Packers with petty post
content: the trolls were out once again in Week 9 of the NFL season . the Panthers clinched the win with a 49-yard field goal from Ryan Fitzgerald . a panther posted a graphic of the Lambeau Leap with the caption "Pack it up"

title: Gujarat: Jilted lover plants CCTV behind ex’s house; tracks her 24x7
content: a man from mehsana district has been booked for stalking and invading her privacy . he is an anganwadi employee in a village in Kadi taluka . the accused allegedly continued harassing her, followed her to her workplace, loitered near her home .
